content: My official URL for this profile is http://nccn.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/order-template when I run the IG tool it is not creating a folder name StructureDefinition? Is that something I need to create and move the files into that folder? It will create the file StructureDefinition-order-template.html.

@Grahame Grieve Should the IGPublisher be creating the relevant redirects for the different URL representations of the resource? Is this something that's even possible to do when you don't know what the web server will be?
only creates those when I run it in a special publication mode
because they are meaningless except for the canonical location
Is that a switch I need to add?

not that simple. it's a longer discussion. when you publish, do you follow the HL7 publishing pattern with regard to version - that is, package-list.json, a history page built using http://hl7.org/fhir/history.js, the current version published at [canonical] and all versions at [canonica]/[folder] ?
I dont believe so, I dont see a package-list.json file.
Would I need to change the file name StructureDefinition-order-template.html to StructureDefinition\order-template.html
no. it doesn't matter what you call it - the IG publisher knows where you put it, and will generate the appropriate redirects. If , that is, you follow the publishing pattern

hmmm not sure that I understand how this is going to work. so the IG publisher tool created a file StructureDefinition-order-template.html the URL for this profile is StructureDefinition/order-template. I dont see a redirects that will route this page.
the IG publisher will create the redirect
when you run it in maintain-publications mode
but you can only run that mode if the preconditions are met
